intro: Psorospermum mossoense, commonly known as the Mossoense psorospermum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
